frame.name: Preferred_alternative_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>In this scenario, there are two mutually incompatible scenes, the <fen>Profiled_possibility</fen> and the <fen>Opposite_possibility</fen>, leading respectively to a preferable <fen>Positive_consequence</fen> and a dispreferable <fen>Undesirable_consequence</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Profiled_possibility
FE.definition: <def-root>The situation presented explicitly as a possible for agents to influence that leads to a better situation, contrasting with the implicit <fen>Opposite_possibility</fen> that leads to a worse situation.</def-root>

FE.name: Opposite_possibility
FE.definition: <def-root>The implicit situation that is mutually exclusive with the <fen>Profiled_possibility</fen>. It is presented as leading to a less desirable situation, the <fen>Undesirable_consequence</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Positive_consequence
FE.definition: <def-root>The preferable situation that follows from the <fen>Profiled_possibility</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Undesirable_consequence
FE.definition: <def-root>The less desirable situation that follows as a result of the <fen>Opposite_possibility</fen>.</def-root>
